alert.note: Alert for Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 5:58PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Livingston County through 645 PM CST... At 558 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gridley, or 14 miles southwest of Pontiac, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pontiac, Gridley, Flanagan, Odell and Cornell. Including the following interstate... I-55 between mile markers 191 and 212. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
